title: Ticket #785: improve flat-file condor_history performance
description:
As everyone knows, condor_history flat-file scanning is very bad. Recently, i was trying to help stuart anderson from LIGO and could not come up with a good solution to his condor_history problems.

Summary of the rust ticket: user stuart anderson at LIGO needs to debug old jobs using condor_history. He does not wish to run quill, has too many jobs to benefit from any kind of leave_in_queue hack, and is experiencing very long waits (almost 10 minutes) when looking up jobs direct by cluster id using condor_history.
remarks:
2009-Oct-09 14:11:17 by psilord:
After speaking with LIGO on 10/9/2009, they said that this was a low priority ticket. They'd like to keep it on the agenda because it is useful for debugging Condor problems. In the era of Google searches, waiting 5 minutes to search 10 million classads seems a bit slow....
creator: psilord
